HTMLIFrameElement.summary: The HTMLIFrameElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of inline frame elements.

remarks.para: -The HTML element implementing this interface: iframe

HTMLIFrameElementAllow.summary: The allow property of the interface indicates the Permissions Policy specified for this <iframe> element. The policy defines what features are available to the <iframe> element (for example, access to the microphone, camera, battery, web-share, etc.) based on the origin of the request.

remarks.para: The Permissions Policy specified by the allow attribute implements a further restriction on top of the policy specified in the Permissions-Policy header. It doesn't replace it.
See <iframe>'s Permissions Policy syntax for more details.
It reflects the allow attribute of the iframe element.
-Permissions Policy

HTMLIFrameElementAllow.value: A string indicates the Permissions Policy specified for this iframe element, each policy must be separated by space.

HTMLIFrameElementAllowFullscreen.summary: The allowFullscreen property of the interface is a boolean value that reflects the allowfullscreen attribute of the {{HTMLElement("iframe")}} element, indicating whether to allow the iframe's contents to use .

blockquote.para: This property is considered a legacy property. Use allow="fullscreen" and instead.

remarks.para:
-Fullscreen API
-
-Permissions Policy
-Permissions-Policy/fullscreen Permissions Policy directive

HTMLIFrameElementAllowPaymentRequest.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The allowPaymentRequest property of the
interface returns a boolean value indicating
whether the Payment Request API may be invoked on a cross-origin iframe.

remarks.para: -Payment Request API

summary.blockquote: WARNINGThis feature is currently opposed by two browser vendors. See the Standards positions section for details of opposition.

remarks.para: The browsingTopics property of the interface is a boolean specifying that the selected topics for the current user should be sent with the request for the associated {{htmlelement("iframe")}}'s source in a {{httpheader("Sec-Browsing-Topics")}} header. This reflects the browsingtopics HTML attribute.
See Using the Topics API for more details.
-Topics API

HTMLIFrameElementBrowsingTopics.value: A boolean. The default value is false; set it to true to send the associated <iframe> source request with a Sec-Browsing-Topics header containing the selected topics for the current user.

HTMLIFrameElementContentDocument.summary: If the iframe and the iframe's parent document are Same Origin, returns a Document (that is, the active document in the inline frame's nested browsing context), else returns null.

HTMLIFrameElementContentWindow.summary: The contentWindow property returns the Window object of an HTMLIFrameElement.

remarks.para: This attribute is read-only.

HTMLIFrameElementCredentialless.summary: NOTE Experimental The credentialless property of the interface indicates whether the {{htmlelement("iframe")}} is credentialless, meaning that documents inside will be loaded using new, ephemeral contexts.

remarks.para: Those contexts do not have access to their network, cookies and storage data associated with their origin. Instead, they use new ones, local to the top-level document lifetime. It means any data stored won't be accessible anymore after the user navigates away from the page or reloads it.

In return, the Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy (COEP) embedding rules can be lifted, so documents with COEP set can embed third-party documents that do not. See IFrame credentialless for a deeper explanation.

-IFrame credentialless
-iframe

HTMLIFrameElementCredentialless.value: A boolean. The default value is false; set it to true to make the <iframe> credentialless.

HTMLIFrameElementCsp.summary:
NOTE Experimental The csp property of the
interface specifies the Content Security Policy that an
embedded document must agree to enforce upon itself.

HTMLIFrameElementFeaturePolicy.summary:
NOTE Experimental The featurePolicy read-only
property of the interface returns the
interface which provides a simple API for introspecting
the Permissions Policies applied to a specific frame.
HTMLIFrameElementFeaturePolicy.value:
A FeaturePolicy object
that can be used to inspect the Permissions Policy settings applied to the frame.

HTMLIFrameElementGetSVGDocument.summary: The getSVGDocument() method of the interface returns the object of the embedded SVG.

HTMLIFrameElementHeight.summary: The height property of the interface returns a string that reflects the height attribute of the iframe element, indicating the height of the frame in CSS pixels.
HTMLIFrameElementHeight.value: A string indicating the height of the frame in CSS pixels.

HTMLIFrameElementLoading.summary: The loading property of the interface is a string that provides a hint to the {{Glossary("user agent")}} indicating whether the iframe should be loaded immediately on page load, or only when it is needed.

remarks.para:
This can be used to optimize the loading of the document's contents.
Iframes that are visible when the page loads can be downloaded immediately (eagerly), while iframes that are likely to be offscreen on initial page load can be downloaded lazily â€” just before they will appear in the window's visual viewport.

-The iframe element
-Learn: Web performance
-Lazy loading in the MDN web performance guide
-It's time to lazy-load offscreen iframes! on web.dev

HTMLIFrameElementLoading.value:
A string providing a hint to the user agent as to how to best schedule the loading of the iframe.
The possible values are:

HTMLIFrameElementName.summary: The name property of the interface is a string value that reflects the name attribute of the iframe element, indicating the specific name of the <iframe> element.

HTMLIFrameElementPrivateToken.summary: NOTE Experimental The privateToken property of the interface returns a string representation of an options object representing a private state token operation; this object has the same structure as the RequestInit dictionary's privateToken property.

remarks.para: This attribute mirrors the content of the associated <iframe> element's privateToken attribute.
-Private State Token API

HTMLIFrameElementReferrerPolicy.summary:
The
HTMLIFrameElement.referrerPolicy
property reflects the HTML referrerpolicy attribute of the
iframe element defining which referrer is sent when fetching the
resource.

remarks.para:
-,
, and
.

HTMLIFrameElementSandbox.summary: The read-only sandbox property of the returns a live object indicating extra restrictions on the behavior of the nested content. It reflects the {{HTMLElement("iframe")}} element's sandbox content attribute.
HTMLIFrameElementSandbox.value: A live object.Although the sandbox property itself is read-only in the sense that you can't replace the DOMTokenList object, you can still assign to the sandbox property directly, which is equivalent to assigning to its property. You can also modify the DOMTokenList object using the , , , and methods.

HTMLIFrameElementSrc.summary:
The HTMLIFrameElement.src
A string that reflects the src HTML attribute, containing the address of the content to be embedded.

remarks.para: Note that programmatically removing an <iframe>'s src attribute (e.g., via ) causes about:blank to be loaded in the frame.

summary.blockquote:
WARNINGThis property parses its input as HTML, writing the result into the frame's DOM.
APIs like this are known as injection sinks, and are potentially a vector for cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, if the input originally came from an attacker.

remarks.para:
You can mitigate this risk by always assigning TrustedHTML objects instead of strings and enforcing trusted types.
See Security considerations for more information.
The srcdoc property of the interface gets or sets the inline HTML markup of the frame's document.
This reflects the srcdoc attribute of the iframe.

HTMLIFrameElementSrcdoc.value:
Getting the property returns a string containing the HTML serialization of the frame's document.
This is undefined if the value is not set.Setting the property accepts either a object or a string.
It parses this input as a HTML document and replaces the content of the frame with the result.

HTMLIFrameElementWidth.summary: The width property of the interface returns a string that reflects the width attribute of the iframe element, indicating the width of the frame in CSS pixels.
HTMLIFrameElementWidth.value: A string indicating the width of the frame in CSS pixels.
